---
layout: page
#
# Content
#
title: "boxhist2: Univariate Exploration of a CSV File (Flexible Formatting)"
teaser: "Exercise template with more flexible formatting for assessing the interpretation of exploratory statistics (quantiles) and graphics (boxplot and histogram) based on a randomly-generated CSV file."
categories:
  - templates
tags:
  - cloze
  - boxplot
  - histogram
  - 1-sample
  - visualization
  - statistics
  - moodle
author: zeileis

mathjax: true
webex: true

#
# Style
#

  thumb: boxhist2.small.png
---

<div class='row t20 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Preview:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'><div class="webex-group">
<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>For the 49 observations of the variable <code>x</code> in the data file <a href="data:text/csv;base64,">boxhist.csv</a> draw a histogram, a boxplot and a stripchart. Based on the graphics, answer the following questions or check the correct statements, respectively. <em>(Comment: The tolerance for numeric answers is <span class="math inline">\(\pm0.8\)</span>, the true/false statements are either about correct or clearly wrong.)</em></p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">The distribution is unimodal:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>true</option><option value='answer'>false</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">The distribution is:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value='answer'>symmetric</option><option value=''>right-skewed</option><option value=''>left-skewed</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">The boxplot shows outliers:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>true</option><option value='answer'>false</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">A quarter of the observations is smaller than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.8' size='20' data-answer='["2.55"]'/></td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">A quarter of the observations is greater than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.8' size='20' data-answer='["13.1"]'/></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">Half of the observations are smaller than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.8' size='20' data-answer='["10.4"]'/></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<div class="webex-solution">
<p><br />
<img src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<ul>
<li>False / True</li>
<li>True / False / False</li>
<li>False / True</li>
<li>2.55</li>
<li>13.1</li>
<li>10.4</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>For the 34 observations of the variable <code>x</code> in the data file <a href="data:text/csv;base64,eAozLjEzCjMuMDgKMy41OQozLjMKMy41NAozLjI2CjMuMzEKMy4yOQozLjQyCjMuMjkKMy45MQo2LjQxCjMuODYKNC42OQoyLjk2CjMuNDQKMy4zMgo3LjAzCjQuODEKNy4zNQozLjEyCjMuNDYKMy44NQo1LjIxCjMuMjcKMy43CjMuMzEKMy4yNAo1LjQ1CjYuMDYKMi45Nwo0Ljg5CjMuNTIKMi45Ngo=">boxhist.csv</a> draw a histogram, a boxplot and a stripchart. Based on the graphics, answer the following questions or check the correct statements, respectively. <em>(Comment: The tolerance for numeric answers is <span class="math inline">\(\pm0.2\)</span>, the true/false statements are either about correct or clearly wrong.)</em></p>

<div class="webex-question">
<div class="webex-check webex-box">
<p>For the 49 observations of the variable <code>x</code> in the data file <a href="data:text/csv;base64,">boxhist.csv</a> draw a histogram, a boxplot and a stripchart. Based on the graphics, answer the following questions or check the correct statements, respectively. <em>(Comment: The tolerance for numeric answers is <span class="math inline">\(\pm0.6\)</span>, the true/false statements are either about correct or clearly wrong.)</em></p>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">The distribution is unimodal:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>true</option><option value='answer'>false</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">The distribution is:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value='answer'>symmetric</option><option value=''>right-skewed</option><option value=''>left-skewed</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">The boxplot shows outliers:</td>
<td align="left"><select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>true</option><option value='answer'>false</option></select></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">A quarter of the observations is smaller than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.6' size='20' data-answer='["4"]'/></td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left">A quarter of the observations is greater than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.6' size='20' data-answer='["15"]'/></td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left">Half of the observations are smaller than:</td>
<td align="left"><input class='webex-solveme nospaces' data-tol='0.6' size='20' data-answer='["13.7"]'/></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<div class="webex-solution">
<p><br />
<img src="data:image/png;base64," /></p>
<ul>
<li>False / True</li>
<li>True / False / False</li>
<li>False / True</li>
<li>4</li>
<li>15</li>
<li>13.7</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>

<div class='row t20 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Description:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Univariate numeric data for download in a CSV file (comma-separated values) need to be assessed using quantiles (three numeric items) and exploratory graphics (three single-choice items). Data are drawn randomly from a suitable data-generating process so that the single-choice items are either about correct or clearly wrong. The six items are embedded into the exercise using "##ANSWERi##" tags for somewhat improved layout.</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Solution feedback:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Randomization:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Random numbers, text blocks, and data file</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Mathematical notation:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Verbatim R input/output:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>No</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Images:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>Yes</div>
</div>
<div class='row t1 b1'>
  <div class='medium-4 columns'><b>Other supplements:</b></div>
  <div class='medium-8 columns'>No</div>
</div>

</div>

_(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML, rendered by MathJax using 'mathjax = TRUE'. Instead it is also possible to use 'converter = "pandoc-mathjax"' so that LaTeX equations are rendered by MathJax directly.)_

**Demo code:**

<pre><code class="prettyprint ">library(&quot;exams&quot;)

set.seed(403)
exams2html(&quot;boxhist2.Rmd&quot;, mathjax = TRUE)
set.seed(403)
exams2pdf(&quot;boxhist2.Rmd&quot;)

set.seed(403)
exams2html(&quot;boxhist2.Rnw&quot;, mathjax = TRUE)
set.seed(403)
exams2pdf(&quot;boxhist2.Rnw&quot;)</code></pre>
